hint: Conceptual PYQ QUESTIONS 37. Sea water, which can be considered as a 6 molar (6M) solution of NaCl, has a density of 2 g mL-1. The concentration of dissolved oxygen (<math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>) in sea water is 5.8 ppm. Then the concentration of dissolved oxygen (<math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>) in sea water, is x×<math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>-4</mn></msup></math> m. x = ____________.(Nearest integer) Given: Molar mass of NaCl is 58.5 g mol-1Molar mass of <math><msub><mi>O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is 32 g mol-1 a) 1 b) 2 c) 3 d) 4 Key: b
